00001 #ifndef NETWORKMANAGER_H
00002 #define NETWORKMANAGER_H
00003 #include <SFML/Network.hpp>
00004 
00008 class NetworkManager
00009 {
00010 public:
00014     void ListenToPort(unsigned int port)
00015     {
00016         socket.Unbind();
00017         socket.Bind(port);
00018     }
00019 
00023     void ReceivePackets();
00024 
00028     void BlockPacketsFromSender(const sf::IpAddress & address)
00029     {
00030         blockedList.push_back(address);
00031     }
00032 
00036     void ResetBlockedSenders()
00037     {
00038         blockedList.clear();
00039     }
00040 
00044     void Send(sf::Packet & packet)
00045     {
00046         for (unsigned int i = 0;i<recipientsList.size();++i)
00047             socket.Send(packet, recipientsList[i].first, recipientsList[i].second);
00048     }
00049 
00053     void AddRecipient(const sf::IpAddress & ipAdress, const short unsigned int port)
00054     {
00055         recipientsList.push_back(std::pair<sf::IpAddress, short unsigned int>(ipAdress, port));
00056     }
00057 
00061     void RemoveAllRecipients()
00062     {
00063         recipientsList.clear();
00064     }
00065 
00066     static NetworkManager *getInstance()
00067     {
00068         if ( !_singleton )
00069         {
00070             _singleton = new NetworkManager;
00071         }
00072 
00073         return ( static_cast<NetworkManager*>( _singleton ) );
00074     }
00075 
00076     static void kill()
00077     {
00078         if ( _singleton )
00079         {
00080             delete _singleton;
00081             _singleton = 0;
00082         }
00083     }
00084 private:
00085     NetworkManager() {socket.SetBlocking(false);};
00086     virtual ~NetworkManager() {};
00087 
00088     sf::UdpSocket socket;
00089 
00090     std::vector< std::pair<sf::IpAddress, short unsigned int> > recipientsList; 
00091     std::vector<sf::IpAddress> blockedList; 
00092 
00093     static NetworkManager *_singleton;
